result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Attorney Jason Daane. Defendant, Joshua Borst, in court. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed
Signed bond filed with the court.

Must comply with PRE-TRIAL SERVICES. MUST MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Joshua R Borst in court, in custody by video. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jason Daane appeared specially. Discussion as to bond. Bond set at $1000 signature. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
